sentences.english: The gondoliers wore green and white livery and silver plaques on their chest.
sentences.chinese: 船伕們穿着白綠兩色的制服，胸前彆着銀質徽章。

sentences.english: The Rising Sun was the badge of Edward III.
They are even going to put a little Mercedes badge by the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 他們甚至想在腕部放一個小的奔馳徽章。

sentences.english: Phoebe finds a police badge under a cushion at the coffee house.
sentences.chinese: 菲比在咖啡館的沙發墊下發現一枚警察徽章。

sentences.english: People in China used the badges to signify their zeal for the cause.
sentences.chinese: 在中國人使用徽章以示對革命事業的熱情。

sentences.english: And who doesn’t love a family crest worn a leather wrist-cuff?
sentences.chinese: 可是誰不喜歡家族徽章是皮製腕套呢？

sentences.english: One of them was wearing a Virginia Lion’s Club pin.
sentences.chinese: 其中一人彆着一枚弗吉尼亞獅子會俱樂部的徽章。

sentences.english: The sheriff's badge was shaped like a star.
sentences.chinese: 治安官的徽章是星狀的。

sentences.english: The officer was wearing a medal.
sentences.chinese: 那位軍官佩帶着一枚徽章。

sentences.english: Camden badging along with a range of smaller tweaks completes the look.
sentences.chinese: 卡姆登徽章以及一系列小的調整完成了期待。

sentences.english: Don't polish those badges; the gilt will wear off in time if you do.
sentences.chinese: 不要擦這些徽章，否則鍍上去的金總有一天會磨掉的。

sentences.english: Under a wool jacket with a miniature American flag pin on the lapel.
sentences.chinese: 外頭套件羊毛夾克，翻領上彆着小小的美國國旗徽章。

sentences.english: The gondoliers were green and white living and silver plaques on their chests .
sentences.chinese: 船伕們穿着白綠兩色的制服，胸前彆着銀質徽章。

sentences.english: "So these badges, I hope, will help some people to notice I am pregnant," she said.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我希望這些徽章能讓人們注意到我是個孕婦。

sentences.english: Pupils in Hong Kong usually have distinctive badges on their school uniforms.
sentences.chinese: 在香港，小學生的校服上常戴有頗具特色的徽章。

sentences.english: We will order achievement badges and attachments according to this list.
sentences.chinese: 我們將依此名單訂製會員成就徽章及附件。

definition: (archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token
